DOC.brief_summary: ABSORB FIRST prospective , multi-center registry . The objective study : - Provide ongoing post-market surveillance documentation safety , performance clinical outcome Absorb BVS ( Bioresorbable Vascular Scaffold ) System daily percutaneous coronary intervention ( PCI ) practice per Instructions Use ( IFU , on-label use ) . - To evaluate safety performance 12 mm short Absorb BVS single overlapping use ( bailout , optimization long lesion treatment ) treatment patient ischemic heart disease cause de novo native coronary artery lesion ( ) - Collect additional information ( e.g . acute success ) evaluate handle implantation Absorb BVS physician wide range commercial use condition follow routine clinical practice .
DOC.brief_title: ABSORB FIRST Registry Designed Evaluate Safety Performance Absorb Bioresorbable Vascular Scaffold ( Absorb BVS ) Used Real-world Patients .
DOC.detailed_description: ABSORB FIRST Registry intend provide assessment safety performance Absorb BVS device accordance IFU real world use involve complex patient , lesion use ( example : long lesion , overlap use , bailout , patient high risk cardiac event , etc. ) . The ABSORB FIRST study register minimum 1800 patient approximately 90 site throughout multiple country worldwide Absorb BVS regulatory approval commercially available .
DOC.criteria: The inclusion criterion must follow recent IFU may include limited following : Patient must least 18 year age time sign Informed Consent Form Patient treat de novo lesion locate previously untreated vessel . Patient must agree undergo require followup visit data collection . The exclusion criterion must follow recent IFU may include limited following : Inability obtain sign informed consent potential patient .
